alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 10:14AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Colorado, including the following areas, in central Colorado, Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet. In north central Colorado, Jackson County Below 9000 Feet and South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet. * WHEN...Through 6 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread showers and embedded thunderstorms are expected to develop late Friday morning into Friday afternoon, continuing overnight. Heavy rain will be possible with any thunderstorms that develop.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
